docs.lead_paragraph: Normally it takes years to prove a new vaccine is both safe and effective before it can be used in the field. But with hundreds of people dying a day in the worst ever outbreak of Ebola, there is no time to wait.

headline.main: Scientists Grapple With Ethics in Rush to Release Ebola Vaccines
headline.print_headline: Scientists Grapple With Ethics in Rush to Release Ebola Vaccines

docs.snippet: Normally it takes years to prove a new vaccine is both safe and effective before it can be used in the field. But with hundreds of people dying a day in the worst ever outbreak of Ebola, there is no time to wait.

docs.lead_paragraph: Two experts say we shouldn’t waste time worrying if Ebola might in the future be transmitted through the air.

headline.main: Transmission of Ebola: Two Microbiologists Weigh In

docs.lead_paragraph: Deaths from infectious diseases like malaria, diarrhoea and pneumonia are likely to soar in West African countries where a vast outbreak of Ebola has crushed health systems and killed nurses and doctors.

headline.main: 'Collateral' Death Toll Expected to Soar in Africa's Ebola Crisis

headline.main: Finding Humane Care at the End of Life

docs.abstract: What can be done to insure that the elderly get the care they want and need, particularly in their dying days?
docs.snippet: What can be done to insure that the elderly get the care they want and need, particularly in their dying days?

docs.lead_paragraph: Sierra Leone on Thursday took the dramatic step of sealing off districts where more than 1 million people live as it and other West African countries struggle to control the Ebola outbreak that has claimed thousands of lives.

headline.main: Sierra Leone Quarantines 2 Million to Fight Ebola

docs.lead_paragraph: The patient, a slight woman in her 30s, lay motionless on the stretcher as a half-dozen men in biohazard suits transferred her from a C-27J cargo plane into an ambulance and then into a mobile hospital isolation ward, never once breaking the plastic seal encasing her.

docs.lead_paragraph: A Red Cross team was attacked while collecting bodies believed to be infected with Ebola in southeastern Guinea, the latest in a string of assaults that are hindering efforts to control West Africa's current outbreak.

headline.main: Red Cross Team Attacked While Burying Ebola Dead
headline.print_headline: Red Cross Team Attacked While Burying Ebola Dead

docs.lead_paragraph: West Africa's Ebola epidemic is the largest the world has ever seen, but infectious disease experts are almost as fearful of a long-term legacy in humans as they are about the deaths it is causing right now.

headline.main: Ever-Present Endemic Ebola Now Major Concern for Disease Experts
headline.print_headline: Ever-Present Endemic Ebola Now Major Concern for Disease Experts

docs.snippet: West Africa's Ebola epidemic is the largest the world has ever seen, but infectious disease experts are almost as fearful of a long-term legacy in humans as they are about the deaths it is causing right now.

docs.lead_paragraph: Health teams that went door-to-door in Sierra Leone found 130 confirmed cases of Ebola during a nationwide shutdown to slow the spread of the disease, an official said Tuesday, as authorities consider repeating the unprecedented exercise.

headline.main: Sierra Leone: 130 Ebola Cases Found in Lockdown
